channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Event-based Background-Oriented Schlieren
item.description: Schlieren imaging is an optical technique to observe the flow of transparent media, such as air or water, without any particle seeding.

item.title: Efficient LLM Inference on CPUs
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance and tremendous potential across a wide range of tasks.

item.title: Active Instruction Tuning: Improving Cross-Task Generalization by Training on Prompt Sensitive Tasks
item.description: Instruction tuning (IT) achieves impressive zero-shot generalization results by training large language models (LLMs) on a massive amount of diverse tasks with instructions.

item.title: Robust Graph Clustering via Meta Weighting for Noisy Graphs
item.description: We add a learnable weight to each node pair, and MetaGC adaptively adjusts the weights of node pairs using meta-weighting so that the weights of meaningful node pairs increase and the weights of less-meaningful ones (e. g., noise edges) decrease.

item.title: OpenForest: A data catalogue for machine learning in forest monitoring
item.description: These datasets are grouped in OpenForest, a dynamic catalogue open to contributions that strives to reference all available open access forest datasets.

item.title: Boosting Summarization with Normalizing Flows and Aggressive Training
item.description: This paper presents FlowSUM, a normalizing flows-based variational encoder-decoder framework for Transformer-based summarization.

item.title: NeuralGF: Unsupervised Point Normal Estimation by Learning Neural Gradient Function
item.description: Specifically, we introduce loss functions to facilitate query points to iteratively reach the moving targets and aggregate onto the approximated surface, thereby learning a global surface representation of the data.

item.title: ChatGPT-Powered Hierarchical Comparisons for Image Classification
item.description: The zero-shot open-vocabulary challenge in image classification is tackled by pretrained vision-language models like CLIP, which benefit from incorporating class-specific knowledge from large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT.

item.title: End-to-End Single-Channel Speaker-Turn Aware Conversational Speech Translation
item.description: Conventional speech-to-text translation (ST) systems are trained on single-speaker utterances, and they may not generalize to real-life scenarios where the audio contains conversations by multiple speakers.

item.title: An Embedded Diachronic Sense Change Model with a Case Study from Ancient Greek
item.description: These models represent the senses of a given target word such as "kosmos" (meaning decoration, order or world) as distributions over context words, and sense prevalence as a distribution over senses.

item.title: Learning Cooperative Trajectory Representations for Motion Forecasting
item.description: Specifically, we present V2X-Graph, the first interpretable and end-to-end learning framework for cooperative motion forecasting.

item.title: Detecting Syllable-Level Pronunciation Stress with A Self-Attention Model
item.description: Thus, knowing the stress level is important for English speakers and learners.

item.title: Latent Space Translation via Semantic Alignment
item.description: While different neural models often exhibit latent spaces that are alike when exposed to semantically related data, this intrinsic similarity is not always immediately discernible.

item.title: TPSeNCE: Towards Artifact-Free Realistic Rain Generation for Deraining and Object Detection in Rain
item.description: We first introduce a Triangular Probability Similarity (TPS) constraint to guide the generated images toward clear and rainy images in the discriminator manifold, thereby minimizing artifacts and distortions during rain generation.

item.title: RAUNE-Net: A Residual and Attention-Driven Underwater Image Enhancement Method
item.description: Underwater image enhancement (UIE) poses challenges due to distinctive properties of the underwater environment, including low contrast, high turbidity, visual blurriness, and color distortion.

item.title: Robustness Tests for Automatic Machine Translation Metrics with Adversarial Attacks
item.description: We investigate MT evaluation metric performance on adversarially-synthesized texts, to shed light on metric robustness.

item.title: Prompt-based Logical Semantics Enhancement for Implicit Discourse Relation Recognition
item.description: Essentially, our method seamlessly injects knowledge relevant to discourse relation into pre-trained language models through prompt-based connective prediction.

item.title: Adaptive Latent Diffusion Model for 3D Medical Image to Image Translation: Multi-modal Magnetic Resonance Imaging Study
item.description: Our model exhibited successful image synthesis across different source-target modality scenarios and surpassed other models in quantitative evaluations tested on multi-modal brain magnetic resonance imaging datasets of four different modalities and an independent IXI dataset.

item.title: HARE: Explainable Hate Speech Detection with Step-by-Step Reasoning
item.description: With the proliferation of social media, accurate detection of hate speech has become critical to ensure safety online.

item.title: Intriguing Properties of Data Attribution on Diffusion Models
item.description: Data attribution seeks to trace model outputs back to training data.

item.title: LLMRec: Large Language Models with Graph Augmentation for Recommendation
item.description: By employing these strategies, we address the challenges posed by sparse implicit feedback and low-quality side information in recommenders.

item.title: SoulChat: Improving LLMs' Empathy, Listening, and Comfort Abilities through Fine-tuning with Multi-turn Empathy Conversations
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have been widely applied in various fields due to their excellent capability for memorizing knowledge and chain of thought (CoT).

item.title: DEFN: Dual-Encoder Fourier Group Harmonics Network for Three-Dimensional Macular Hole Reconstruction with Stochastic Retinal Defect Augmentation and Dynamic Weight Composition
item.description: Macular hole diagnosis and treatment rely heavily on spatial and quantitative data, yet the scarcity of such data has impeded the progress of deep learning techniques for effective segmentation and real-time 3D reconstruction.

item.title: Noisy Exemplars Make Large Language Models More Robust: A Domain-Agnostic Behavioral Analysis
item.description: Recent advances in prompt engineering enable large language models (LLMs) to solve multi-hop logical reasoning problems with impressive accuracy.

item.title: Unleashing the Creative Mind: Language Model As Hierarchical Policy For Improved Exploration on Challenging Problem Solving
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved tremendous progress, yet they still often struggle with challenging reasoning problems.

item.title: CROMA: Remote Sensing Representations with Contrastive Radar-Optical Masked Autoencoders
item.description: We show that these objectives are complementary when leveraged on spatially aligned multimodal data.

item.title: Feature-oriented Deep Learning Framework for Pulmonary Cone-beam CT (CBCT) Enhancement with Multi-task Customized Perceptual Loss
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel feature-oriented deep learning framework that translates low-quality CBCT images into high-quality CT-like imaging via a multi-task customized feature-to-feature perceptual loss function.

item.title: Improving Interpersonal Communication by Simulating Audiences with Language Models
item.description: How do we communicate with others to achieve our goals?

item.title: AdaSent: Efficient Domain-Adapted Sentence Embeddings for Few-Shot Classification
item.description: As a solution, we propose AdaSent, which decouples SEPT from DAPT by training a SEPT adapter on the base PLM.

item.title: Caseformer: Pre-training for Legal Case Retrieval
item.description: Legal case retrieval aims to help legal workers find relevant cases related to their cases at hand, which is important for the guarantee of fairness and justice in legal judgments.

item.title: MNN: Mixed Nearest-Neighbors for Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: In contrastive self-supervised learning, positive samples are typically drawn from the same image but in different augmented views, resulting in a relatively limited source of positive samples.

item.title: Rethinking Variational Inference for Probabilistic Programs with Stochastic Support
item.description: We introduce Support Decomposition Variational Inference (SDVI), a new variational inference (VI) approach for probabilistic programs with stochastic support.

item.title: Continual atlas-based segmentation of prostate MRI
item.description: Continual learning (CL) methods designed for natural image classification often fail to reach basic quality standards for medical image segmentation.

item.title: Contrastive Difference Predictive Coding
item.description: Predicting and reasoning about the future lie at the heart of many time-series questions.

item.title: Bridging the Gap Between Variational Inference and Wasserstein Gradient Flows
item.description: Variational inference is a technique that approximates a target distribution by optimizing within the parameter space of variational families.

item.title: InstructCoder: Empowering Language Models for Code Editing
item.description: In this work, we explore the use of large language models (LLMs) to edit code based on user instructions, covering a broad range of implicit tasks such as comment insertion, code optimization, and code refactoring.

item.title: From Denoising Training to Test-Time Adaptation: Enhancing Domain Generalization for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In medical image segmentation, domain generalization poses a significant challenge due to domain shifts caused by variations in data acquisition devices and other factors.

item.title: Machine learning detects terminal singularities
item.description: Together with the first sketch of the landscape of Q-Fanos in higher dimensions, this gives new evidence that machine learning can be an essential tool in developing mathematical conjectures and accelerating theoretical discovery.

item.title: Extracting Entities of Interest from Comparative Product Reviews
item.description: This paper presents a deep learning based approach to extract product comparison information out of user reviews on various e-commerce websites.

item.title: DDAM-PS: Diligent Domain Adaptive Mixer for Person Search
item.description: The objective of the two bridge losses is to guide the moderate mixed-domain representations to maintain an appropriate distance from both the source and target domain representations.

item.title: Network Contention-Aware Cluster Scheduling with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: With continuous advances in deep learning, distributed training is becoming common in GPU clusters.

item.title: Erato: Automatizing Poetry Evaluation
item.description: We present Erato, a framework designed to facilitate the automated evaluation of poetry, including that generated by poetry generation systems.

item.title: Energy-Aware Adaptive Sampling for Self-Sustainability in Resource-Constrained IoT Devices
item.description: In the ever-growing Internet of Things (IoT) landscape, smart power management algorithms combined with energy harvesting solutions are crucial to obtain self-sustainability.

item.title: Information-Theoretic Trust Regions for Stochastic Gradient-Based Optimization
item.description: Before each update, it solves the trust region problem for an optimal step size, resulting in a more stable and faster optimization process.

item.title: Bilateral Network with Residual U-blocks and Dual-Guided Attention for Real-time Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To be precise, we use the Dual-Guided Attention (DGA) module we proposed to replace some multi-scale transformations with the calculation of attention which means we only use several attention layers of near linear complexity to achieve performance comparable to frequently-used multi-layer fusion.

item.title: General-Purpose Retrieval-Enhanced Medical Prediction Model Using Near-Infinite History
item.description: This approach effectively eliminates the need for manual feature selection and enables an unrestricted observation window.

item.title: Recaptured Raw Screen Image and Video Demoir√©ing via Channel and Spatial Modulations
item.description: The spatial modulation utilizes the feature with large receptive field to modulate the feature with small receptive field.

item.title: BasisFormer: Attention-based Time Series Forecasting with Learnable and Interpretable Basis
item.description: Bases have become an integral part of modern deep learning-based models for time series forecasting due to their ability to act as feature extractors or future references.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks for Road Safety Modeling: Datasets and Evaluations for Accident Analysis
item.description: This paper constructs a large-scale, unified dataset of traffic accident records from official reports of various states in the US, totaling 9 million records, accompanied by road networks and traffic volume reports.

item.title: Object-centric Video Representation for Long-term Action Anticipation
item.description: To recognize and predict human-object interactions, we use a Transformer-based neural architecture which allows the "retrieval" of relevant objects for action anticipation at various time scales.
